monogr.title: Vox clamantis. Mark 1. 3 : A stil voice, to the three thrice-honourable estates of Parliament: and in them, to all the soules of this our nation, of what state or condition soeuer they be. By William Loe, Doctor of Diuinitie, and chaplaine to the Kings most excellent Maiestie
monogr.author: Loe, William

div.head: To the well-disposed Readers.
div.p: IN the worlds birth God spake to our first Parents by a still voyce in the coole of the day;Genesis 3. in the worlds middle age to Elyah after the winde,1 Reg. 19. earthquake, and fire, in a still small voyce, and in this last age of the world, by a didirecting voyce from Heauen,Matth. 17. concerning Christ Iesus his Sonne our Lord, saying, Heare him. In the beginning was the word, yet that word was before all beginning, but the world knew not that Word, but by the voice of men and Angels. And albeit the Word, be in itselfe before the Voyce, yet to the sonnes of men the Voyce goeth before the Word: Therefore is the Fore-runner Iohn Baptist called, The voyce of a Cryer in the Wildernesse.

That is most true: For Christ is the Cryer, Musc. & Maldonat. in Mat. 3 the Baptist is the Voyce; and as in his Fore-runner, so also in his Apostles that followed, and in all other Preachers of his Gospell, Christ saith, and speaketh by the mouthes of all his holy seruants since the world beganne, euen to this day.Iansen Conco. 13. Voyce and Crying must goe together, the Voyce to feed with faith, the Cry to call to Repentance; the Voyce to com • ort, the Cry to controle; the Voyce to tune the musicke of Mercy, Diez: con. 1. Dom. 3. Aduen. Aquin. Caten. Matth. 3. and the Cry to sound the Trumpet to Iudgement. The word of God in writing is the Proclamation, and Gods Ministers are the Voyces of the Criers, to giue notice to all the People, that the Proclamation concernes them, and euery one of them.

Church men then are crying Voyces; they shall neuer be shent in sober zeale for the cause of God, to cry out with Dauid in generall against all the wicked.Psal. 139. 21. Acts 8. Acts 13. Doe not I hate them that hate thee, and am not I grieued with them that rise vp
gainst thee? That in particular cry against a Simon Magus: That he is in the gall of bitternesse, and in the bond of Iniquity. Against an Elimas: That he is full of mischiefe, the childe of the Diuell, and an enemy of all Righteousnesse. Against an hereticall Marcion, that he is the Diuells Darling. Iren. lib. 6 cap. 3 For as to some meeke and modest spirits, Preachers must be Barnabasses, the sons of Consolation: So to others, whose sinnes are of a deeper dye, they must be like Iames and Iohn (Bonarges) sonnes of Thunder.

If wee will neither heare Voyce, nor Cry, nor the voyce of the Cryer; How doe wee thinke God should lend an eare to our voyce when we cry vnto him? Is it not iust with God to say vnto vs, Prouerbs 1. Because I haue called, and yee haue refused; I haue stretched out mine hand, and none will regard: Therefore you shall call vpon me, but I will not answer; you shall seeke me earely, but you shall not finde me. Thinke on this, ye that forget God, yee that suffer Christ to call and cry vnto you, by his Preachers, and ye regard not. Consider this ye great ones, lest God lay your honour in the dust: yee mighty, lest the Almighty throw you downe, and there be none to helpe you vp, lest he tumble you from your seate, and set in your places the humble and meeke.

Doe yee refuse to heare the still voyce of the Cryer, take heede lest the shrill Cryer himselfe cry against you with his great Voyce, which is Powerfull,Psal. 29. full of Maiesty, breaking the Cedars, yea the Cedars of Lebanon, euen the great ones,4. diuiding the flames of fire,5. euen his Ministers whom he maketh flames of fire, shaking the wildernes,7. 8. 9. yea the wildernes of Kadesh, euen the vast, wilde, and wide wickednes of the People. Beware that the Multitude thinke not themselues too many, nor the Cleriques too classicall, nor the mighty too maiesticall to attend the voyce of the Lord. For if they doe so, and will not heare them cry, that wish them to take heede of future wee, then this wildernesse of the world, a Desert of Beasts, rauening Wolues, couetous Foxes, roaring Lyo • s, and the like, shall cast them out into the Land of Obliuion, where they themselues shall doe nothing but howle and crie in woe eternally.

If the Voyce and Cri • be to exasp • rate (as you thinke) for
the lowdnesse thereof: Know ye, it calleth to them that are gone as farre off from God, as the Prodigall was into a farre Countrey, and these haue need of a Trumpet to recall them. If it be too plaine for Clearenesse, know yee, it is the euidence of the spirit of God that you might distinctly discerne what is spoken, proclamed and sounded, that so you might prepare your selues vnto the battell. A lamentable woe would it be vnto you all, if the voyce of all such as cry vnto you from the Lord, should be the vncertaine and hoarse voyces of Hereticall, Schysmaticall, Atheisticall, Papisticall, prophane, vaine deceiuers.

For you know, that if the sonnes of men, who are ordayned, and set apart for this businesse of the Lord, doe not lift vp their voyces like Trumpets, and tell Iacob their sinnes, and Israel their transgressions, God will open the mouth of an Asse to reproue them, yea God will cause things without life, the stone in the wall, and the beame in the house, to cry out against them. Farewell.

closer.signed: Yours in the Lord, William Loe.
